page.title: 14ABC CINEMA, EDGWARE
page.content: This information was collected during an interview with the Manager. The cinema opened in 1932, when the present Manager was 10.He began work there on Saturday morning shows, but became Assistant Manager full-time in 1950. He was appointed Manager in 1971. He recalls "The Towering Inferno", "The Sting" and, particularly, all the Steven Spielberg movies as big money makers. The cinema shows mostly ABC, EMI and Rank films. Competition comes mainly in the form of t.v. and video cassettes. The theatre operates between 1300 and 2245. Important films are shown in Studio 1, which has 705 seats. Others are screened in Studios 2 or 3, with 207 and 196 seats respectively. The Manager believes the future of the cinema to be very bleak here.
